description:
Construction of a new house.  This application represents an amendment to the Planning Permission approved in June 2004 (Ref 2003/1938/P).  

Conservation Area Consent for demolition of the existing house has already been granted under Ref 2003/1939/C.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The facing materials to be used on the development hereby approved shall be as shown on drawing numbers PL 013 revision B and PL 015 revision B, (clear glazed, translucent glazing panel, cantilevered glass balustrrade, polished and honed granite, doors -garage, entrance, steel framed glass and sliding, fair-faced concrete) and shall be retained and maintained thereafter. 

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - Details of the retractable shading device with solar cantrolled glass hereby approved and shown on drawing numbers PL 015 revision B, PL 018 revision A, PL 019 revision A  shall be submitted at scale 1:20 and approved by the Council in writing before work commenced on site.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - 
Details of the boundary metal mesh fence (in terms of colour, texture and weathering capabilities) hereby approved and shown on drawing numbers PL 015 revision B, PL 021 revision A, shall be submitted at scale 1:20 and approved by the Council in writing before work commenced on site.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - 
All existing trees on site or adjacent shall be protected in accordance with the relevant recommendations of British Standards BS5837: 1991. 

Reason: To ensure the preservation of the amenity value and health of the tree(s).
Condition : 6 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least 5 years following the completion of the development hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. 

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - Details shall be submitted to the Council before works commence on site to demonstrate how the tree on the southern boundary (drawing PL 014) shall be protected during construction work: such details shall for instance include measures to protect the tree trunk, to prevent additional soil compaction around the root zone, and to reduce damage to the lower branches including any proposals for crown uplifting.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
